definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
a flower may blossom again, but a person cannot get young again (proverb)
pinyin: hua1 you3 chong2 kai1 ri4 , ren2 wu2 zai4 shao4 nian2
containing_words.word: 花有重開日，人無再少年

sentences.english: Today was the grand opening and Karla and Melanie were lost .
sentences.chinese: 今天才剛隆重開幕，卡拉和梅拉妮也在裏面迷路了。

sentences.english: After that day, I went to the temple and I reopened it before the people.
sentences.chinese: 那天之後，我來到神殿，並當衆重開了神殿的大門。

sentences.english: The opening ceremony of Lucky International English---the Era Digital Center was officially opened last saturday.
sentences.chinese: 樂其國際英語，時代數碼廣場八中心上週在隆重開業。

sentences.english: Today we are gathering here for the grand opening ceremony of the Universal Postal Congress.
sentences.chinese: 今天，萬國郵政聯盟大會將在這裏隆重開幕7。

sentences.english: Non-govenment anti-corruption website "I bribe" permanently closed after 20 days re-opened.
sentences.chinese: 民間反腐網站“我行賄了”重開20天后永久關閉。

sentences.english: While no-one seems interested in re-opening Old Sydney Town.
sentences.chinese: 與此同時好像沒有人對重開舊悉尼鎮感興趣。

sentences.english: The 5th Shenyang Annual Science Scholar Conference opened yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 昨日上午，第五屆瀋陽科學學術年會隆重開幕。

sentences.english: The conference was solemnly opened yesterday.
Cards could be seen all over the neighborhood for the grand opening of an Italian restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 一家意大利餐廳隆重開幕標示牌可以在整個社區看到。

sentences.english: Rotarians celebrate the grand opening of the House of Friendship. Rotary Images/Alyce Henson.
sentences.chinese: 扶輪社員慶祝友誼之家的隆重開幕。

sentences.english: Leading health consultation center practise gr.
sentences.chinese: “領標健康諮詢中心”隆重開業。

sentences.english: The grand opening of the Beijing Paralympic Games will be held this evening.
sentences.chinese: 今晚，北京殘奧會將隆重開幕。

sentences.english: Used for medium to heavy wire in relation to screen opening size.
sentences.chinese: 用於中就有關重開線到屏幕的大小。

sentences.english: The meeting will begin the following December in Beijing ceremoniously.
sentences.chinese: 大會將於今年十二月在北京隆重開幕。

sentences.english: The schools were closed, and did not reopen till Quisling backed down.
sentences.chinese: 學校被迫關閉，直到吉斯林讓步才重開。

definition: to respond accordingly to/to adapt to/to cope with
"Red Poppies", novel by 阿來|阿来[A1 lai2]
lit. the dust has settled (idiom)/fig. to get sorted out/to be finalized
auxiliary verb introducing future action: may (be able to)/will (cause)/should (enable)/going to
to add to existing facilities or services
(of a check etc) to cash/to honor a commitment
